project.name: Fishlinic
project.tagline: Real‑time water quality + AI fish health.
project.overview: Fishlinic is a smart aquaculture platform that uses Arduino sensors and ESP32-CAM to monitor water quality and fish health. It also uses AI to detect diseases and provide insights for farmers. We are a team of 5 students from Sejong University in South Korea. We are passionate about helping farmers improve their productivity and sustainability. We are also dedicated to using technology to improve the lives of farmers and their families.

features.title: AI
features.desc: AI to detect diseases and provide insights for farmers.

features.title: Dashboard
features.desc: Web dashboard to monitor the data and provide insights for farmers.

features.title: Arduino
features.desc: Arduino to read the sensors and ESP32-CAM to read the video feed.

features.title: ESP32-CAM
features.desc: ESP32-CAM to read the video/image feed.

features.title: Arduino
features.desc: Arduino to read the sensors and ESP32-CAM to read the video feed.

team.name: Azizbek Arzikulov
team.bio: I am a software engineer and hardware engineer. I am passionate about using technology to improve the lives of farmers and their families. My tasks are to develop the web dashboard, the bridge, and the firmware.

timeline.what: Hardware Setup, Demo Web Dashboard, AI Models Training
Dashboard v2, ESP32-CAM Stream, AI Models Deployment
Connect AI models API to the dashboard, YOLOv11 training, Virtual Assistant Development (optional), Fish Feeding System Development (optional)
Testing, Documentation, Improvement, Final Presentation, Final Report
